intro: Dissotis pachytricha var. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental thick-stemmed sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its robust, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and swampy areas. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, which are typical of the sedge family.
